page.title: 07HOUSING:WOKINGHAM WITHOUT
page.content: Much of the housing is{owner-occupied and{detached}with large gardens,but some houses recently built are{compact with very small gardens. The cost of land has risen sharply since 1960. {Council owned property}is in small groups in Gorrick Square,Nine Mile Ride,Hatch Ride,Palmer Close,Holme Green and Waterloo Road. Many tenants are buying their houses from the Council.The{Lucas Hospital}is a home for the elderly owned and administrated as a charity by the {Royal and Worshipful Company of {Drapers.}It consists of ten flats for independent{pensioners.}There is a resident matron,and a trained nurse. Residents pay a fixed maintenance charge. There is much new building going on, and a park for{mobile homes is being prepared. The area is becoming less rural.
